rev.comment: sources indicate it will not have MicroSD

The Galaxy Nexus is expected to feature 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref>, 1024 MB of RAM, a 1750 mAh battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
The Galaxy Nexus is expected to feature 4.65-inch 1280Ã720-pixel [[Super AMOLED]] HD with curved glass,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|Ti OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref>, 1024 MB of RAM, a 1750 mAh battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]].<ref name="brighthand18084"/>
â
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen [[soft keys]] embedded into the system software. The 3.5mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone features a [[microSD]] slot for storage expansion, and will have 16GB/32GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
+
The phone has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen [[soft keys]] embedded into the system software. The 3.5mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the centre of the rear side. The phone does not feature a [[microSD]] slot for storage expansion, but will have 16GB/32GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
